When PEST performs parameter estimation, each prior information equation is evaluated. The equation result is treated like a simulation result and is compared with a preferred value. The first type of prior information equation compares the the current value of the parameter to it's initial value. It is applicable to all parameters.The second type only applies to parameters that are associated with pilot points. With those, the current value of a pilot point value is compared with the values of neighboring pilot points. The third type of prior information equation also only applies to parameters that are associated with pilot points. With those, the values pilot points associated with the same parameter at the same location on adjacent layers will be compared.
